english_translation: Narrated by Farwah ibn Musayk: I asked the Prophet ﷺ about Saba. I said: O Messenger of Allah, what is Saba? Is it a man, a mountain, or a valley? He said: No, rather it is a man who had ten children. Four went westward and six went eastward. Westward: Lakhm, Judham, Amilah, and Ghasssan. Eastward: Himyar, Mudhhaj, Al-Azd, Kindah, Al-Ash'areen, and Anmaar from which are Bajilah and Khath'am

english_translation: Narrated by Abyadh ibn Hammal al-Muradi: I requested from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ the salt land called Shaththa for a need. He granted it to me. Then al-Aqra' ibn Habis al-Tamimi said: O Messenger of Allah, I have come to the salt land in the pre-Islamic era and it was in a land where there is no water, and whoever came to it could take from it, and it is like flowing water. So the Prophet ﷺ asked Abyadh ibn Hammal to reconsider the grant. Abyadh said: I will reconsider it on the condition that you make it charity. The Prophet ﷺ said: It is charity from you. And it is like flowing water, and whoever comes to it may take from it. And the Messenger of Allah ﷺ gave him land and water in al-Goufa, Jarf Murad, when he reconsidered it. [Second chain mentions similar narration through another path]

english_translation: Narrated by Salamah ibn Yazid al-Jufi: My brother and I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and asked: O Messenger of Allah, our mother in the pre-Islamic era used to entertain guests. Will that benefit our mother in anything? He said: No. We said: She buried alive a sister of ours who had not reached puberty. The Prophet ﷺ said: The one who buries alive and the one buried alive are in the Fire except if the one who buries alive becomes Muslim, and Allah forgives her

chainIssues: Mix of thiqah and saduq narrators
Generally reliable chain

Topics: Incident of two brothers asking about their mother
Ruling on pre-Islamic actions of parents
Punishment for burying girls alive
Condition of repentance and forgiveness in Islam

english_translation: Salamah ibn Yazid al-Jufi: I came with my brother to the Prophet ﷺ and asked him about our mother's deeds in the pre-Islamic era. The Prophet ﷺ said deeds from the period of ignorance do not benefit anyone after Islam unless they become Muslim
